greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of denominators of harmonic mean of n and m, 1 <= m <= n.
comment: See the comments under A227041. a(n,m) gives the denominator of H(n,m) = 2*n*m/(n+m) in lowest terms.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Harmonic Mean .
example: The triangle of denominators of H(n,m), called a(n,m) begins:
For the triangle of the rationals H(n,m) see the example section of A227041.
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jul 01 2013
